Name: Displaying a passengers’ bill of rights in commuter vans.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to displaying a passengers’ bill of rights in commuter vans.

\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\tab Section 1.  Subdivision b of section 19-537 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj b.  Every owner of a taxicab [or]\ul , \ulnone livery \ul or commuter van \ulnone shall post passengers\rquote  bill of rights in at least one conspicuous location in the rear passenger compartment of such taxicab [or]\ul , \ulnone livery \ul or commuter van\ulnone  in a form and location to be prescribed by commission rule.\par
\'a7 2.  Subdivisions e and f of section 19-537 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York are relettered as subdivisions f and g, respectively, and a new subdivision e is added to read as follows:\par
\ul e.  The commuter van passengers\rquote  bill of rights shall state passengers\rquote  rights to:\par
(1)  a vehicle that is in good condition and has passed all required inspections;\par
(2)  a properly licensed driver in good standing, with the commission-issued driver\rquote s license information on display;\par
(3)  a safe and courteous driver who obeys all traffic laws; \par
(4)  a knowledgeable driver who is familiar with the areas where the van is authorized to provide service; \par
(5)  air conditioning or heat on request; \par
(6)  a quiet trip free of horn honking or radio or other music playing; \par
(7)  clean air, which is smoke and scent free; \par
(8)  working seatbelts; \par
(9)  a clean vehicle, both inside and outside; \par
(10)  be accompanied by a service animal;\par
(11)  a driver who does not use a cell phone (hand-held or hands free) while driving; and\par
(12)  decline to tip for poor service.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\ulnone\'a73.  This local law shall take effect ninety days after it is enacted into law.\par
